dc.title: United States Institute of Peace: Committed to the Prevention, Management, and Peaceful Resolution of International Conflicts
dc.description: The United States Institute of Peace is an independent nonpartisan national institution established and funded by Congress. Our mission is to help prevent, manage, and resolve international conflicts by empowering others with knowledge, skills, and resources, as well as by our direct involvement in peacebuilding efforts around the world.
dc.subject: peace international conflict resolution affairs foreign policy institute human rights peacemaking peace-making peacekeeping peace-keeping democracy management postconflict post-conflict research government negotiation rule of law war crimes ethnic religion ethics non-violent humanitarian mediation grant fellowship Track II National Peace Essay Contest essay contest independent government agency igo virtual diplomacy Jeannette Rankin balkans iraq
